info.title: Vectera REST API Reference
info.description:
The Vectera REST API is hosted at https://www.vectera.com/api/v1/. This document lists the available endpoints and methods. Endpoints and fields that are not listed below may change at any moment. [Check our guides](https://help.vectera.com/collections/2245690) to get started with the API. Chat with us or reach out to api@vectera.com to get more help. # Authorization Request an API token at api@vectera.com. Send the token with every request in a HTTP header: ``` Authorization: Token {token} ``` # Searching Some endpoints allow you to search for a given value using a `search={query}` parameter. For example: ``` GET /users/me/meetings?search=meeting-room-name ``` If an endpoint supports searching, the documentation below will list the fields that will be searched when the `search` query parameter is provided. # Filtering To further narrow down your search, you can use the more advanced `filter={query}` query parameter. You can filter on most fields in a resource, and you can combine filters with the boolean operators `AND` and `OR`. Some examples of valid filter queries: * `isTrashed = false` * `key ~ "vectera"` * `size > 1000 AND lastOpened < 2021-01-01T00:00` * `(ownerId = 8d077d9b-528d-4d4c-bfe8-1a9945090b6d OR ownerId = ea970f9b-092c-4564-898a-d04c2d9b91b6) AND isTrashed = false` Dont' forget to [URL encode](https://www.w3schools.com/tags/ref_urlencode.ASP) your filter queries, for example: ``` GET /users/me/meetings?filter=isTrashed=false # INCORRECT GET /users/me/meetings?filter=isTrashed%3Dfalse # CORRECT ``` ## Operators The filter parameter supports the following operators: | Operator | Definition | Example | |----------|---------------------------|---------------------------------------------------| | = | Equals* | `isOpened = true` | | != | Does not equal* | `ownerId != 8d077d9b-528d-4d4c-bfe8-1a9945090b6d` | | ~ | Contains* | `key ~ "vectera"` | | !~ | Does not contain* | `key !~ "test"` | | > | Is greater than | `size > 0` | | >= | Is greater than or equals | `timeActive >= 01:00:00` | | < | Is less than | `lastOpened < 2021-01-01T00:00` | | <= | Is less than or equals | `size <= 1000000` | *All string comparisons are case insensitive. ## Data Types The filter parameter supports the following data types: | Data type | Description | Example | |------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------------------|------------------------| | String | Any text inside double quotes | `"vectera"` | | Integer or real number | An unquoted number | `100`, `-2.5` | | Boolean | The unquoted string `true` or `false` | `true`, `false` | | Null | The unquoted string null | `null` | | Datetime | An unquoted ISO-8601 string: `YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm[:ss[.uuuuuu]][+HH:MM\|-HH:MM\|Z]` | `2021-01-01T10:00:00Z` | | Duration | An unquoted string of the format `[DD] [HH:[MM:]]ss[.uuuuuu]` | `01:00:00` | # Ordering To order the results of a query, you can pass a comma-delimited list of fields to the `orderBy={fields}` query parameter. To order in descending order, prefix a field with a minus sign (`-`). Some examples: ``` GET /users/me/meetings?orderBy=-lastOpened GET /organizations/{uuid}/meetings?orderBy=ownerId,-lastOpened ``` # Pagination You can choose the number of results you want to get on a single page with the query parameter `perPage={number}`, up to a maximum of 100 results per page. Information about pagination is provided in the `Link` header of an API response. For example, assuming you have 20 meeting rooms, performing the following request: ``` GET /users/me/meetings?perPage=2 ``` will include the following header in the response: ``` Link: ; rel="next", ; rel="last" ``` # Optional Fields Some endpoints contain optional fields. In a `GET` request, these fields are not included by default to improve performance and reduce response size. You can explicitly request the server to include these fields using the `include={fields}` query parameter. For example: ``` GET /users/me/appointments ``` will include a field `hostId`, that is a reference to the User that hosts the appointment. If you want to get more information about this User, for example its `fullName`, you need another API request: ``` GET /users/{hostId} ``` To avoid this second API call, you can request to include the User information in the first API call: ``` GET /users/me/appointments?include=host ``` You can drill down even further, for example to include information about the host's Organization: ``` GET /users/me/appointments?include=host.organization ``` You can also include multiple optional fields in one request: ``` GET /users/me/appointments?include=host.organization,guest ``` If an endpoint has any optional fields, the documentation below will list these. Nested optional fields (like `host.organization` in the example above) are not listed. # Rate Limits To help prevent strain on Vectera's servers, our API imposes a limit of 100 requests per minute for each user. If a request exceeds this limit, a `429` status code will be returned. If you want to raise this limit for your account, please get in touch with api@vectera.com.

List of Endpoints

tags.name: ActiveInterval
tags.description:
An Active Interval is a period of time during which 2 or more people were joined in a Meeting Room, at least one of whom was sharing their audio and/or video.

Active Intervals are currently updated one minute after a meeting has ended. This behaviour may change without prior notice.

tags.name: Appointment
tags.description: An Appointment booked through a Vectera booking page.

tags.name: Feedback
tags.description: Feedback can be left by a guest after a meeting is over. Feedback consists of a star rating and an optional message.

tags.name: MeetingPermission
tags.description: A Meeting Permission contains a private link that gives you access to a specific meeting room.

tags.name: MeetingRoom
tags.description: A Meeting Room is where you meet people and share content.

tags.name: MeetingSession
tags.description: A Meeting Session corresponds to a single user joining a Meeting Room.

tags.name: MeetingTemplate
tags.description: A Meeting Template allows you to populate new Meeting Rooms with predefined content.

tags.name: Member
tags.description: An Organization in Vectera exists of one or more Members. Each Member has their own Vectera account. Members can create meeting rooms, personal Appointment Types,... Admin Members can in addition edit the Organization's settings, invite new Members, create team Appointment Types,...

tags.name: Organization
tags.description: A group of Members with a single brand and billing account.

tags.name: OrganizationInvite
tags.description: An email invitation to join an Organization.

tags.name: Recording
tags.description: A video Recording of a meeting that took place in a Meeting Room.

tags.name: User
tags.description: Anyone who logs into Vectera or joins a meeting room has a User object associated with them.

id.description: A UUID string identifying this User.

username.description: A username that must be unique across all Users.

shortName.description: The User's first name, or email address if no first name is known.

fullName.description: The User's full name, or email address if no first name is known.

isAuthenticated.description: Whether the User has signed up for a Vectera account. When someone joins a meeting room without signing up, a User with `isAuthenticated = false` is automatically created.

email.description: A unique value identifying this User.

isManaged.description: A managed User cannot login with a password, only with a Login Token that was created through the API. They cannot edit their personal details.

isAdmin.description: Whether the User is an admin of their Organization.

dateJoined.description: The datetime when the User first signed up.

organizationId.description: The ID of the Organization this user belongs to.

name.description: The Organization's name. Caution: unless you have a custom domain set, changing the name of an Organization will also change the URLs of all Meeting Rooms and booking pages.

slug.description: A unique value identifying this Organization.

customDomain.description: The domain name on which this Organization's meeting and booking pages are hosted.

cameraBackgroundImage.description: The image that is used as a virtual background in meeting rooms.

favicon.description: The favicon used for this Organization's Meeting Room and booking pages.

storageUsed.description: The total amount of cloud storage used by this Organization's Members, in bytes.

storageTotal.description: The limit of cloud storage this Organization can use in bytes.

permanentInviteUrl.description: Anyone with this link can use it to join this Organization.

teamWaitingRoomEnabled.description: Whether this Organization's team waiting room should be open for knockers.

showPrivateNotes.description: Whether the private notes buttons should be visible for the Meeting Room host.

presenterMode.description: Whether presenter mode is currently active.

forwardUrl.description: The URL that guests will be forwarded to after the meeting is over.

settings.description: Various settings that control the Meeting Room look and behaviour.

isActive.description: Whether this account is currently active. Inactive accounts are also called "Suspended". They cannot log into Vectera, but their content is still accessible for other team members. If `isAccepted` is `false`, this field is ignored.

email.description: The email address to send this invitation to. Provide either `email` or `user`, but not both.

user.description: The user to send this invitation to. Provide either `email` or `user`, but not both.

message.description: The invite message to send in the email.

id.description: A UUID string identifying this Appointment.

name.description: The name of this Appointment's Appointment Type

start.description: The datetime when the Appointment is scheduled to start.

end.description: The datetime when the Appointment is scheduled to end.

hostId.description: The ID of the User that will host the Appointment.

id.description: A UUID string identifying this User.

username.description: A username that must be unique across all Users.

email.description: A unique value identifying this User.

fullName.description: The User's full name, or email address if no first name is known.

shortName.description: The User's first name, or email address if no first name is known.

isAuthenticated.description: Whether the User has signed up for a Vectera account. When someone joins a meeting room without signing up, a User with `isAuthenticated = false` is automatically created.

organizationId.description: The ID of the Organization this user belongs to.

id.description: A UUID string identifying this Organization.

name.description: The Organization's name. Caution: unless you have a custom domain set, changing the name of an Organization will also change the URLs of all Meeting Rooms and booking pages.

slug.description: A unique value identifying this Organization.

customDomain.description: The domain name on which this Organization's meeting and booking pages are hosted.

cameraBackgroundImage.description: The image that is used as a virtual background in meeting rooms.

favicon.description: The favicon used for this Organization's Meeting Room and booking pages.

storageUsed.description: The total amount of cloud storage used by this Organization's Members, in bytes.

storageTotal.description: The limit of cloud storage this Organization can use in bytes.

permanentInviteUrl.description: Anyone with this link can use it to join this Organization.

teamWaitingRoomEnabled.description: Whether this Organization's team waiting room should be open for knockers.

teamWaitingRoomUrl.description: The URL of this Organization's team waiting room, if it is enabled.

allowEditAppointments.description: Whether non-admins can see and edit the appointments of other Members.

organization.description: The Organization this user belongs to.

guest.description: The User that booked the appoinment.

address.description: If the Appointment is offline: the address where the Appointment will take place. This address is configured on the Appointment Type, and cannot be chosen by the guest.

telephone.description: If the Appointment is a phone call: the phone number of the guest.

meetingId.description: If the Appointment is online: the ID of the Meeting Room where the Appointment will take place.

id.description: A UUID string identifying this Meeting Room.

description: The identifier that is used to compose the Meeting Room URL. Must be unique within your Organization.

preferredKey.description: A Meeting Room's `key` must be unique within your Organization. If you try to create a Meeting Room with a `key` that already exists, an error will be returned. You can provide `preferredKey` instead of `key` if you want Vectera to automatically resolve conflicts by appending a postfix (e.g. "-2").

url.description: The URL on which you can join this Meeting Room.

size.description: The total size in bytes of this Meeting Room. Calculated by summing the size of all Files and Recordings in the Meeting Room.

templateId.description: The ID of the Meeting Template on which this Meeting Room is based. Set this field when creating a Meeting Room to apply a template.

snapshot.description: A snapshot of the content that was last active in the Meeting Room.

snapshotName.description: The name of the content the snapshot was taken of.

ownerId.description: The ID of the Meeting Room owner.

allowEditAppointments.description: Whether non-admins can see and edit the appointments of other Members.

organization.description: The Organization this user belongs to.

dateCreated.description: The datetime on which this Meeting Room was created. Persists across resets.

dateResetted.description: The datetime on which this Meeting Room was last resetted. `null` if the Meeting Room has never been resetted.

isOpened.description: Whether there is currently at least one participant in the meeting room.

openedSince.description: The time when the Meeting Room last started being opened. `null` if the Meeting Room has never been opened.

openedUntil.description: The time when the Meeting Room last stopped being opened. `null` if the Meeting Room is currently opened.

isActive.description: Whether there are currently two or more participants in the meeting room, at least one of whom is sharing their audio or video.

activeSince.description: The time when the Meeting Room last started being active. `null` if the Meeting Room has never been active.

activeUntil.description: The last time the Meeting Room stopped being active. `null` if the Meeting Room is currently active.

timeActive.description: The total time two or more participants were in the Meeting Room, at least one of whom were sharing their audio or video

allowGroupMeetings.description: Whether meetings with more than 2 people are allowed.

allowMultipleWhiteboards.description: Whether creating more than 1 whiteboard is allowed.

allowRecording.description: Whether creating a local Recording is allowed.

allowCloudRecordings.description: Whether uploading a Recording is allowed.

showPrivateNotes.description: Whether the private notes buttons should be visible for the Meeting Room host.

presenterMode.description: Whether presenter mode is currently active.

description: If enabled, the Meeting Room will be automatically reset 2 minutes after the host leaves.

forwardUrl.description: The URL that guests will be forwarded to after the meeting is over.

forwardImmediately.description: Whether the redirect to `forwardUrl` should be instantaneous. If not, a message is shown to the user for a few seconds announcing that they will be redirected.

showHostLogin.description: Whether to show a login button on the greet screen.

settings.description: Various settings that control the Meeting Room look and behaviour.

publicAccessLevel.description: The access level of anyone who visits the Meeting Room URL.

teamAccessLevel.description: The access level of the Meeting Room host's team members who visit the Meeting Room URL.

meeting.description: If the Appointment is online: the Meeting Room where the Appointment will take place.

url.description: If the Appointment is online: the URL of the Meeting Room where the Appointment will take place.

isCancelled.description: When setting this field to `true`, by default an email will be sent to the guest notifying them of this action. To disable this email: set `sendUpdates = false` while setting `isCancelled = true`.

customQuestionsAnswers.description: The answers that the guest provided to the custom questions that were asked while booking the Appointment.

sendUpdates.description: When you cancel the Appointment through the API, provide this field to choose whether to send an email update to the guest. Note that the guest's calendar may send them an email regardless of this setting.
